page.title: 15THE RIVER DON
page.content: The four square kilometers that we surveyed are on two hills with the Don valley in between. The river Don runs through the bottom of the valley. The valley goes from north to south, with the town of Rotherham to the north and the city of Sheffield to the south. On the hills to the west of the River Don is Masborough and Kimberworth. To the east of the river we have the village of Canklow and on the highest point of the hills behind Canklow is Bolton Castle. On the flat land alongside the River Don there is a railweay and a canal. This is where all the large steel works like Templeborough were built to take advantage of the canal. The River Rother runs along the valley in front of Canklow to join the River Don in the centre of Rotherham.
